title: UPDATE ON PRECAUTIONARY MEASURES FOR STALLHOLDERS
description: 18TH JUL 20211.　 　 　As announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) on 17 July 2021, COVitemid-19 clusters have been uncovered involving fishmongers who visited the Jurong Fishery Port to collect their stock and sell at the markets.2.　 　 　As a precautionary measure, fresh fish and seafood stallholders at markets managed by the National Environment Agency (NEA) or NEA-appointed operators were disallowed from operating this morning in order to prevent any further transmission.　These stallholders have or will be receiving an SMS Health Risk Warning (HRW) from MOH.　The HRW means that the person is required by law to get a Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) test at designated testing centres.　Until tested negative, the person is required to self-isolate and not leave their home.　3.　 　 　Affected fish and seafood stallholders can also to walk in to specified Regional Screening Centres (Annex) today　should they wish to get their PCR tests done as soon as possible. Stallholders who receive a negative PCR test result are able to resume business immediately.4.　 　 　In addition to the PCR test, fresh fish and seafood stallholders will be issued with self-test Antigen Rapid Test (ART) kits and are required to self-administer an ART test on the seventh day from the last exposure. They will also be required to undergo another PCR test at designated testing centres around the 14th　day from their date of last known exposure.
